title: Pinot Noir Tasting
description:
Join us on Wednesday, November 12, from 4–7 PM at Whispering Vine South Creek for a curated exploration of Pinot Noir styles from California and Oregon—ranging from bold and dark-fruited to bright, lifted, and elegant.

Tasting Fee: $35 (Buy a bottle from the tasting and your fee is refunded)

Featured Wines:

• Belle Glos Dairyman Vineyard Pinot Noir 2022 – 94 pts Wine Enthusiast – Deep, plush, and richly textured with blackberry pie, dark chocolate, cedar, and baking spice.

• Flowers Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir 2023 – 94 pts Jeb Dunnuck, 93 pts James Suckling, 92 pts Wine Spectator – Fresh and detailed with red berries, citrus zest, black tea, and lifted coastal energy.

• Four Graces Pinot Noir 2022 – 91 pts Wine Spectator – Expressive and robust with raspberry, guava, rose petal, and tea notes over refined tannins.

• Chalk Hill Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir 2023 – 92 pts James Suckling, 91 pts Wine Spectator – Fresh and spice-lined with blood orange, raspberry, pine, and forest floor complexity.

Taste through four distinct takes on Pinot Noir—discover your favorite and get your tasting free with any bottle purchase.
